enWisdom: Negligence is the opposite of judiciousness

Wisdom: الْغَفْلَةُ تَكْسِبُ الِاغْتِرَارَ وَتُدْنِي مِنَ الْبَوَارِ
enWisdom: Negligence reaps delusion and brings one closer to destruction

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالْغَفْلَةَ وَالِاغْتِرَارَ بِالْمُهْلَةِ فَإِنَّ الْغَفْلَةَ تُفْسِدُ الْأَعْمَالَ وَالْآجَالَ تَقْطَعُ الْآمَالَ
enWisdom: Beware of negligence and being deluded by respite, for indeed negligence corrupts deeds, and death cut off hopes

Wisdom: بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَ الْمَوْعِظَةِ حِجَابٌ مِنَ الْغَفْلَةِ وَالْغِرَّةِ
enWisdom: Between you and the admonition there is a veil of heedlessness and negligence
Negligence is enough of a misguidance
One whose negligence is prolonged, his destruction is hastened

Wisdom: مَنْ غَلَبَتْ عَلَيْهِ الْغَفْلَةُ مَاتَ قَلْبُهُ
enWisdom: One whose negligence overcomes him, his heart dies

Wisdom: مَنْ غَفَلَ عَنْ حَوَادِثِ الْأَيَّامِ أَيْقَظَهُ الْحِمَامُ
enWisdom: One who is negligent about the events of [his] days is awakened by death
No deed is accepted from the negligent one
There is no judiciousness with heedlessness
